questions.question: Which term describes a situation where two or more processes are waiting indefinitely for resources held by each other?
Which algorithm is used to ensure that no process is blocked indefinitely by cyclic resource dependencies?

Consider four processes with burst times of 8, 12, 5, and 7 units and arrival times of 0, 2, 4, and 6 respectively. How many context switches occur under a Preemptive Priority Scheduling algorithm if each process has a unique priority and arrives in the given order?
In deadlock avoidance, what resource allocation strategy ensures that a process cannot hold resources while waiting for additional ones?
Which of the following techniques is typically used to extend physical memory by using disk storage?
Which of the following is not a function of the memory manager in an operating system?
What is the purpose of a file descriptor in file management?

options.B: To map file names to disk locations
options.C: To represent an open file in a process

questions.question: Which scheduling algorithm selects the process with the highest priority for execution?
What is the primary purpose of a semaphore in process synchronization?

options.B: To protect critical sections of code

questions.question: What is the term for a situation where a process is waiting for a resource indefinitely and cannot proceed?
Which memory management technique swaps out entire processes from main memory to disk?
In file management, what is the purpose of a directory entry?

options.B: To map file names to disk locations
options.C: To store file attributes and metadata

questions.question: What is the purpose of a page table entry in virtual memory systems?

options.A: To map virtual addresses to physical addresses

questions.question: Which disk scheduling algorithm moves the disk arm towards the end of the disk while servicing requests?
What is a common technique used to prevent disk fragmentation in file management?
Which of the following is a primary advantage of using threads in a multi-threaded process?

options.A: Reduced memory overhead compared to separate processes

questions.question: In memory management, what is the term for a piece of a process that can be individually loaded into memory?
What is the role of an I/O buffer in input/output operations?

options.B: To store data temporarily during I/O operations

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method of implementing file locking for synchronization in file management?
What is the primary role of the command interpreter (shell) in an operating system?

options.B: To translate virtual addresses to physical addresses
options.C: To provide a user interface for executing commands
